meanings.sent1: The scalding sun made the sand too hot to walk on.
meanings.sent2: The soup was too scalding to eat right away.
meanings.sent3: The scalding water in the pool made everyone jump in quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her scalding anger boiled over at the unfair treatment.
meanings.sent5: The scalding metal burned his hand instantly.

meanings.definition: To burn with hot liquid or steam
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to scald yourself with the scalding water.
meanings.sent2: She scalded her hand while pouring the scalding tea.
meanings.sent3: He scalded the milk for the recipe, but it turned out fine.
meanings.sent4: The steam from the scalding pot scalded his face.
meanings.sent5: The chef accidentally scalded the sauce, ruining the dish.
